programme.title: Female Spies of WWII
programme.sub-title: As the Allies cornered the Nazis, D-Day loomed and the Russians dominated the East, the SOE deployed their best agents to help free France; these were the wars boldest and most dazzling heroines.
programme.desc: This series tells the stories of talented female spies that overcame inherent sexism to put their lives on the line for their countries; their espionage efforts helped turn the tides of World War II.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: Amidst the smouldering ruins of WWII, Japan faced devastation unlike any the world had ever seen; the nation rebuilt itself to become a beacon of modern ingenuity, resilience, and remembrance.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Bomber: Terror of WWII
programme.sub-title: With the Battle of Britain over, the central experience of civilian bombing was suffered by Germany; in the Pacific War, the US and Japan successfully used bombing against naval and military targets.
programme.desc: There have been a catalogue of inventions in the history of warfare that have changed the way battles are fought, but one weapon changed not only the battlefield, but war itself: the bomber.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Zahi Hawass is excavating an enclosure called Gisr El-Mudir where sarcophagi containing mysterious mummies and rich painted tombs are discovered; will these treasures lead them to Imhotep?
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: The History of Mother Earth: Gaia Uncovered
programme.desc: Using ancient evidence and the latest NASA technology, historian Bettany Hughes explores the idea that the Earth is a living being and how ancient civilisations learned to respect the Earth.

programme.title: Tõene lugu
programme.desc: Kui habistatud New York Timesi reporter Michael Finkel kohtub mõrvas suudistatud Christian Longoga, kes kasutab Finkeli identiteeti, muutub ta uurimistoo kassi ja hiire manguks. 2015

programme.title: Klaarides arveid

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: Tuntud palgasõdur naaseb oma karjaari suurima triumfi paika ja kohtub taas ammuse armastusega, ka tekivad tal ootamatult tunded talle õhujõudude poolt maaratud naissoost paarilise vastu.

programme.title: Vaike Manhattan
programme.desc: Ka kõige nooremad New Yorki elanikud on hinges romantikud. 10-aastane Gabe armub oma klassiõde Rosemarysse, keda ta varem tahelegi ei pannud. Tudruk satub tema karatepartneriks.

programme.title: Jay ja Vaikne Bob annavad vastuloogi
programme.desc: Napakas duo Jay ja Vaikne Bob asuvad teele Californiasse, et takistada pahatahtlikku filmistuudiot nende teisikutest filmi tegemast.

programme.title: Poorane suvi
programme.desc: 1987. aasta suvel saab kolledži lõpetanud nooruk tood kohalikus lõbustuspargis, kus ta saab parima etevalmistuse paris eluks.

programme.title: Poesellid III (2022)
programme.desc: Randal varbab parast infarkti Dante, Eliase, Jay ja Silent Bobi, et teha film esmatarbekauplusest, kust kõik alguse sai.

programme.title: Lapsehoidja
programme.desc: Vanemad paluvad meessoost tookaaslast hoida nende poega. Jargmisel paeval teatab politsei, et nende kodu on segi pekstud, poeg kadunud, majast leiti videokaamera. Mida sellega kull salvestati? 2014

programme.title: Noored armastajad
programme.desc: 15 aastat parast esmakohtumist naeb 71-aastane Shauna taas 45-aastast Pierrei. Nad alustavad romaani, mis loob sassi Pierrei pereelu, samas kui Shauna peab tegelema tunnetega, millest ta arvas end juba ule olevat.

programme.title: 2 paeva Pariisis
programme.desc: Plaanitud Euroopa ringreis kukub labi ja paar otsustab kulastada ainult Pariisi. Nad loodavad, et kulaskaik armunute linna varskendab nende suhet. Seda enam, et naisele on tegemist kodulinnaga. 2006

programme.title: Vaprad
programme.desc: Kaks noort ja muretut alustavat naitlejannat ajavad mooda Pariisi tanavaid taga oma teatriunistusi, kuni ootamatud raskused nende plaane ohustavad, pannes nende sõpruse proovile.

programme.title: Viimane armastus
programme.desc: Pariisi sattunud leskmees, kes ei raagi prantsuse keelt, ja temast poole noorem tantsuõpetaja puuavad luua peret, samal ajal kui mehe taiskasvanud, võõrandunud lapsed nende sõprusele kaikaid kodaratesse loobivad.

programme.title: Mozart ja vaal
programme.desc: Armastuslugu kahe andeka inimese vahel, kellel on Aspergeri sundroom - autismi vorm, mille mõju kahjustab nende suhte edenemist.

programme.title: Koll
programme.desc: Morvani elanikke hoiavad hirmu all õõvastavad sundmused. Hiljuti kulakesse kolinud poiss Jules tajub oma kodu umbruses millegi kurjakulutava kohalolu.

programme.title: Hirmus Henry (2011)
programme.desc: Kohutav poiss leiab end tegemas kõiki neid asju, mida ta poleks kunagi arvanud end tegevat!

programme.title: Rosie (2018)
programme.desc: Lugu emast, kes uritab kaitsta oma perekonda, kui tema uurileandja muub nende uuritava elamu ja nad jaavad kodutuks.

programme.title: Paljajalu Pariisis
programme.desc: Fiona on esimest korda elus Pariisis, et aidata luhinagelikku tadi Marthat. Jargneb rida katastroofe, milles enamasti on osaline kodutu mees Dom, kes suhtleb ja valjendab ennast taiesti ilma filtrita.

programme.title: On seal keegi? (2008)
programme.desc: Üksildane poiss, kes elab oma vanemate peetavas vanadekodus, uurib talle kinnisideeks olevat teispoolsust, sõbrunedes vananeva mustkunstnikuga.

programme.title: Viimased paevad kõrbes (2015)
programme.desc: Kujuteldav peatukk Jeesuse 40-paevasest paastumisest ja palvetamisest kõrbes; teel kõrbest valja võitleb Jeesus saatanaga kriisis oleva perekonna saatuse parast.

programme.title: Pulmatort
programme.desc: Pered kogunevad rõõmupaevaks - oma laste pulmadeks. Kuid neil on ka aeg oma saladused paevavalgele tuua.

programme.title: Wicker Park
programme.desc: Noor Chicago reklaamiagent on veendunud, et nagi kohvikus oma ammu kaotatud armastatut. Uskumusest saab kinnisidee ja mees paneb kogu oma elu ootele, et naist leida.

programme.title: Kuidas suremas olles maksimaalselt lõbutseda (2012)
programme.desc: Surmavalt haige uusmeremaalane varastab talle vahiraviks annetatud raha, et minna reisile Euroopasse, kus ta armub mõistatuslikku prantslasest hulkurisse.

programme.title: Kinolugu
programme.desc: Suitsiidne tudeng kohtub Seoulis noore naisega, kes otsustab temaga liituda. Edutu filmitegija markab kaunist naitlejannat, kes osutub peaosaliseks filmis, mida ta just vaatamas kais.

programme.title: Põgenemistee
programme.desc: Draama naisest, kes naib olevat vabaduse nimel suuteline kõigeks, valja arvatud minevikuvigadest lahti utlemine.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are giving an elephant an endoscopy to check on the progress of her cancer treatment, and Paul helps an elephant arriving in AandE with chronic diarrhoea.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James sees an emergency case involving two pets, Dr Kiara has concerns about a lump on blue-tongue skink Edward, and Dr Kelly performs tiny surgery on two very small German ram fish.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The heart of the South American continent is the Amazon jungle, the largest woodland on the planet; witness the planets largest eagle, the monkey-hunting harpy, pink dolphins and the giant otter.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter faces a difficult calving at Ed McDonalds farm; can he get a baby out alive and save mum? Also, Julian faces one of his biggest ever challenges trying to treat one-ton Clydesdale horse Howard.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter heads to a neighbours farm hoping that he can save the life of a seriously ill sheep, and cocker spaniel Paddy has an unusual hernia that Julian will need to find a way to fix.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack and join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Program on a house call to the Kakumbi den where another pup has gone missing.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: A future dispersal of young adult dogs in the Manzi pack looks inevitable, the dry season forces the Kakuli pack to take risks, and ecologist Henry identifies a new dog who has joined the Stork pack.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: An emotional emergency for Peter at a friends farm; Steves wife is seriously ill, and now her favourite sheeps life is in the balance. Julian tries to remove an abscess on Karine the alpacas chin.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: A Game of Leopard Thrones
programme.sub-title: An old leopard queen is dead; when Thandi, the new queen, discovers the young cubs left behind, the fight for survival and for the crown of Djuma is on.
programme.desc: The queen of the leopard royal family of the Djuma Private Game Reserve in the Sabi Sands of South Africa has passed on - who will be crowned as the next leopard king and queen?

programme.title: A Game of Leopard Thrones
programme.sub-title: The duke is desperately ill, and a new male wants to claim his territory while trying to kill young Hosana and baby Tlalamba in the process.
programme.desc: The queen of the leopard royal family of the Djuma Private Game Reserve in the Sabi Sands of South Africa has passed on - who will be crowned as the next leopard king and queen?

programme.title: A Game of Leopard Thrones
programme.sub-title: Thanks to Hosanas exceptional hunting skills, Tingana rebuilds his strength, finally challenges Hukumuri for the dukedom, defeats him and keeps his cubs safe.
programme.desc: The queen of the leopard royal family of the Djuma Private Game Reserve in the Sabi Sands of South Africa has passed on - who will be crowned as the next leopard king and queen?

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: This episode introduces lions with distinct personalities and follows them as they hunt and explore new territories, but conflict arises when the mothers return with new cubs.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi, the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs, and yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy takes on Africas wild Zambezi River to unmask an invisible predator thats dragging fisherman to their deaths; locals speak of the Mazunda, but what is this sinister creature?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.sub-title: A dense and vibrant jungle dominates across the tropical Americas; here a group of young gladiators - including poison dart frogs, jaguars and coatis - are looking to earn their stripes.
programme.desc: There are animals born to fight and destined to face their foe across the planet; armed with weaponry, guile and tactics, these gladiators are prepared for battle. Only champions will reign supreme...

programme.sub-title: Jeremy takes on Africas wild Zambezi River to unmask an invisible predator thats dragging fisherman to their deaths; locals speak of the Mazunda, but what is this sinister creature?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.sub-title: A dense and vibrant jungle dominates across the tropical Americas; here a group of young gladiators - including poison dart frogs, jaguars and coatis - are looking to earn their stripes.
programme.desc: There are animals born to fight and destined to face their foe across the planet; armed with weaponry, guile and tactics, these gladiators are prepared for battle. Only champions will reign supreme...

programme.title: Surviving the Asteroid
programme.desc: 66 million years ago: a gigantic asteroid hits the Earth and wipes out the reign of the dinosaurs as no animal weighing more than 500 grams survives this catastrophe. Who are the survivors?

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: The Spinosaurus is one of the strangest dinosaurs to have ever lived; a discovery in Spain could help trace the origins of this mysterious beast.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: Investigators in the Badlands of Wyoming unearth the bones of a Mosasaur, a terrifying marine predator from the dinosaur age.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: If we had to pick one iconic African animal, it would be the elephant. Its ancestors have dominated the world and the five continents through an exceptional evolution.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James treats a Boyds Forest dragon at the clinic, Dr Shane treats a carpet python called Red, and Dr Catherine sees an emergency case; sun conure parakeet Tequila is in a lot of pain.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: There is an enormous territory of plains in the north of South America that changes its appearance twice a year; we discover the capybara, gigantic anacondas, and the few remaining Orinoco crocodiles.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter heads to a neighbours farm hoping that he can save the life of a seriously ill sheep, and cocker spaniel Paddy has an unusual hernia that Julian will need to find a way to fix.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We explore the diverse continent of South America and learn how a pod of orcas snatch seal pups from right under their mothers noses; meanwhile, a jaguar hunts the formidable caiman in the jungle.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Extreme Snakes
programme.sub-title: This is the story of how Australias snakes evolved, over millions of years, to thrive and become dominant predators in every ecosystem on one of the harshest and most extreme continents on Earth.
programme.desc: This two-part series takes you on an epic journey through the most harsh - yet exquisite - landscapes and habitats to uncover the remarkable world of Australia and Africas most extreme snakes.

programme.title: Extreme Snakes
programme.sub-title: Africas diverse snake species have surprisingly adapted to dominate each corner of one of Earths wildest terrains, evolving to thrive in the myriad of habitats of this biodiverse continent.
programme.desc: This two-part series takes you on an epic journey through the most harsh - yet exquisite - landscapes and habitats to uncover the remarkable world of Australia and Africas most extreme snakes.

programme.title: Planet Shark
programme.sub-title: Older than the dinosaurs, sharks have evolved to thrive in even the most hostile of environments; the full scale of their ingenuity is only just beginning to be uncovered.
programme.desc: Sharks are one of the oldest and successful hunters ever to have lived; they dominate every corner of our oceans, but what is it about these extraordinary survivors that makes them so successful?

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: A young bull elephant is rescued after breaking his leg in a violent thunderstorm, and laser technology is used to save an elephant who has come into AandE with severe burns.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James must save a very special bird, Dr Hamish treats very cute Australian mammal Shug, and Dr Lucinda investigates why adopted pet cockatiel Snowy is laying an excessive number of eggs.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The Caribbean Sea is a mythical place with a wild jungle world living on its shores; this region is home to the axolotls, the Montezuma oropendola, dozens of species of tree frogs, and pit vipers.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.
